title: Quiz: FQE Sept 2021 Past Paper
description: Final Qualifying Examination from September 2021 covering filing systems, procurement, and records retention.

questions.question: The following are advantages of terminal digit filing except

options.text: No annual shift back of notes after weeding
All new files are added to one end
New and old notes are evenly distributed

questions.explanation: In TDF, files are distributed evenly. Adding all files to one end is characteristic of Consecutive Numbering, not TDF.
questions.hint: Which option describes Serial filing instead?

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a filing equipment for case notes
questions.explanation: Cards are the *media*, not the equipment.
questions.hint: Which is what you file, not what you file IN?

questions.question: The following are the contents of a common tracer card except
questions.explanation: DOB is not essential for temporary tracking of file location.
questions.hint: Which is demographic, not tracking info?

questions.question: The following are procedures used in the acquisition of health records equipment except.
questions.explanation: Disposal is for getting rid of old assets, not acquiring new ones.
questions.hint: Which is about ending, not beginning?

questions.question: ____ is a document used for receiving goods from the supplies department before storage.
questions.explanation: S13 is the Counter Receipt Voucher.

questions.question: When formulating the retention policy the hospital must consider the following except.

options.text: Cost involved in finding inactive filing space
Patients full names and date of birth
The volume of medical research undertaken

questions.explanation: Policy is broad; it doesn't depend on specific patient names.

questions.question: The following are factors hindering the implementation of electronic health records except.
questions.explanation: Insurance info is data, not a barrier.

questions.question: ____ is a systematic process of checking to see whether a product or service being developed is meeting specified requirements.
questions.explanation: QC focuses on the output inspection.

questions.question: The act that provides the ability to access information held by public authorities but recognize the need of protection to personal data is called
questions.explanation: Public Records Act / Access to Info Act.

questions.question: "No burial or release of body without a burial permit" the statement is outlined in which medical records act
questions.explanation: Public Health Act governs body disposal.

questions.question: ____ is the protection of information system or medical records against unauthorized disclosure, alteration or destruction.
questions.explanation: Security protects confidentiality and integrity.

questions.question: When the patient is seen subsequently by another doctor, strictly the doctor has no ____ of access to the notes made by the previous doctor
questions.explanation: Access is based on need-to-know, not absolute legal right.

questions.question: ____ is a process through which the level of desired quality is defined, pursued, achieved and maintained in a hospital.
questions.explanation: Quality Assurance is the full cycle of maintaining standards.

questions.question: Who among the following officers issues births and deaths certificates
questions.explanation: Civil Registration Department (Registrar). HRIOs issue notifications, not certificates.

questions.question: In a hospital, an appointment can be made in various areas including the main reception. This type of appointment is called ____
questions.explanation: If it happens in various areas AND main reception, it's Combined.

questions.question: The location of the admission office should ideally be;

options.text: Near the main entrance to the hospital and ward

questions.explanation: Accessible to arriving patients and wards.

questions.question: The following are benefits of computerized medical records except.
questions.explanation: Decreased efficiency is a flaw, not a benefit.

questions.question: The membership of the health records committee includes the following cadres except
questions.explanation: Patients are not standard members of this technical committee.

questions.question: Admission of psychiatric patients may be formal or informal. This is prescribed in which act.
questions.explanation: Mental Health Act.

questions.question: ................................ is a method of destroying computerized data.
questions.explanation: Degaussing destroys magnetic data.

questions.question: Outline five advantages of a centralized waiting list.
questions.explanation:
Advantages:

  1. Fairness
  2. Efficiency/Max Occupancy
  3. Standardization
  4. Better Statistics
  5. Reduced Duplication

questions.question: State five factors to be considered when establishing a health records department.
questions.explanation:
Factors:

  1. Location
  2. Space
  3. Workflow
  4. Equipment
  5. Staffing

questions.question: Outline five responsibilities of the medical records committee.
questions.explanation:
Responsibilities:

  1. Policy Formulation
  2. Forms Control
  3. Quality Assurance
  4. Standardization
  5. Disciplinary recommendations

questions.question: Briefly explain any five capabilities of an Electronic Health Records.
questions.explanation:
Capabilities:

  1. Interoperability
  2. Decision Support
  3. Concurrent Access
  4. Audit Trails
  5. Reporting
questions.hint: What can a computer do that paper can't?

questions.question: State five functions of a bed bureau.
questions.explanation:
Functions:

  1. Monitor Occupancy
  2. Emergency Admissions
  3. Waitlist Admissions
  4. Liaison
  5. Statistics

questions.question: State five importance of telemedicine.
questions.explanation:
Importance:

  1. Accessibility (Remote)
  2. Cost-Effective
  3. Speed of diagnosis
  4. Education
  5. Convenience

questions.question: Outline five advantages of return appointment made in the same clinic.
questions.explanation:
Advantages:

  1. Continuity of care
  2. Convenience (known date)
  3. Accuracy (doctor decides)
  4. Reduced Admin work
  5. Compliance

questions.question: List five advantages of using a unit number for filing.
questions.explanation:
Advantages:

  1. Continuity of history
  2. Efficiency in retrieval
  3. Cost/Space effective
  4. Simplicity (One number)
  5. Research value

questions.question: Outline procedures in ensuring quality assurance and dimensions of filing quality (Long Answer).
questions.explanation:
Procedures: Standards, Data Collection, Evaluation, Correction, Monitoring.
Dimensions: Accuracy, Timeliness, Completeness, Security, Accessibility.
